title: Capacity Waterfall
desc: Visual flow of sales capacity from beginning to end of quarter, showing gains and losses.

title: Current Capacity
desc: Total selling power available right now, measured in dollars or RRE.

title: Gap to Target
desc: Difference between your target capacity and current capacity.

title: Loss Capacity
desc: Total selling power lost to attrition and transfers in a period.

title: Recovered Gap
desc: Portion of lost capacity regained via backfills, transfers, or ramp within the window.

title: Unrecovered Gap
desc: Lost capacity not recovered within the measurement window (in $ or RRE).

title: Code of Conduct
desc: Sales Wiki is an open, welcoming community for sales, RevOps, and finance.

title: Contributing Guide
desc: Thank you for contributing to Sales Wiki!

title: Headcount vs Capacity
desc: Headcount counts people; capacity measures productive selling power.

title: Ramp Curves
desc: Model showing how new hire productivity increases from 0% to 100% over time.

title: What is Capacity Planning
desc: Process of forecasting and managing sales team selling capacity.

title: Welcome to Sales Wiki
desc: The canonical, open-source glossary for Sales Capacity & Performance metrics,.

title: Attrition Rate
desc: Percentage of reps who leave within a given period. Track voluntary vs involuntary.

title: Backfill Rate
desc: Percentage of lost capacity recovered through backfill hires in a period.

title: Capacity at Risk
desc: Estimated sales capacity likely to be lost to attrition in coming period.

title: Productivity Metrics
desc: Measures of individual and team output relative to capacity.

title: Quarterly Quota
desc: Revenue target assigned to a sales rep for a single quarter.

title: Recovery Lag
desc: Average time between when an employee leaves and replacement reaches same level.

title: RRE (Ramped Rep Equivalent)
desc: Convert partially ramped reps into fully ramped equivalents for clean capacity math.

title: Sales Efficiency Ratio
desc: Revenue growth per dollar of S&M spend. Spell out the exact variant used.

title: Time to Backfill
desc: Average days between employee departure and backfill start date.

title: Attrition Management
desc: Process to track, analyze, and respond to employee departures.

title: Backfill Planning
desc: Process of replacing departed sales employees to restore lost capacity.

title: Capacity Planning
desc: Forecasting capacity needs and managing the gap between target and actual.

title: Hiring Planning
desc: Determining when and how many sales hires needed to meet capacity targets.

title: Leave Management
desc: Process for handling employee absences and minimizing capacity impact.

title: Quota Setting
desc: Assigning revenue targets to reps based on capacity and market potential.

title: Territory Planning Basics
desc: Balance potential, ramp, and role mix. Revisit quarterly. Document diffs.
